32.title: Hi and Lois
32.author: by Mort Walker and Dik Browne
32.series: Apr. 17, 1960) "It's Parked Back In Front of the Church!"*
32.appears_in: p. 124 in Battered Husbands (Redondo Beach, CA : H. Gregory Associates, 1991).
notes: Summary: The family is walking home from church on a beautiful day, forgetting all their cares and their car.

33.title: Hi and Lois
33.author: Mort Walker, Dik Browne
33.series: Mar. 31, 1963) "You Should Fight Your Compulsion that you Have to Play Golf Every Sunday No Matter What!"*
33.appears_in: reproduced on p. 322 of The Smithsonian Collection of Newspaper Comics (Washington : Smithsonian Institution Press, 1977).
notes: Summary: Hi leaves to play golf in the rain and mud.

34.title: Hi and Lois
34.author: Dik Browne
34.appears_in: reprinted on p. 152 of The Best of Hi and Lois (Bedford, N.Y. : Comicana Books, 1986).
notes: Summary: Thirsty explains his confidence at golf: the handle of his club is a flask of liquor.

35.title: Hi & Lois
35.author: Dik Browne
35.appears_in: reprinted on p. 153 of The Best of Hi and Lois (Bedford, N.Y. : Comicana Books, 1986).
notes: Summary: Hi returns a severely twisted golf club to Thirsty.

36.title: Hi and Lois
36.author: di Browne
36.appears_in: p. 33 in European Newspaper Comic Strips : a survey of 79 strips collected from various European papers dated August 16 to September 10, 1968 (collection assembled in the Michigan State University Comic Art Collection). This strip taken from Paese Sera (Rome) (Aug. 19, 1968).

37.title: Hi and Lois
37.author: Dik Browne
37.appears_in: reprinted on p. 152 of The Best of Hi and Lois (Bedford, N.Y. : Comicana Books, 1986).
notes: Summary: Thirsty has found his ball in the woods, and Hi offers to toss him what he needs from his golf bag.

38.title: Hi & Lois
38.author: [No author]
38.series: May 14, 1971) "Why Is It We Always Seem To Have Laurel and Hardy Ahead of Us and Palmer and Nicklaus Behind Us?"*
notes: Summary: Hi and Thirsty are on a busy golf course.

39.title: Hi and Lois
39.author: Dik Browne
39.appears_in: p. 120 in Battered Husbands (Redondo Beach, CA : H. Gregory Associates, 1991).
notes: Summary: Thirsty is strutting around because some woman told him he was a perfect male chauvinist.

40.title: Hi & Lois
40.author: Dik Browne
40.series: Feb. 23, 1973) "How Come the Years go by so Fast, and February Takes Forever?"*
40.appears_in: reprinted on p. 166 of The Best of Hi and Lois (Bedford, N.Y. : Comicana Books, 1986).
notes: Summary: Lois and Hi talk about how time flies, but Hi is standing with his golf clubs looking out at the snow.

41.title: Hi and Lois
41.author: Dik Browne
41.series: Aug. 15, 1973) "I'm Going to Get Good at This Game if it Takes All Day!"*
41.appears_in: reprinted on p. 149 of The Best of Hi and Lois (Bedford, N.Y. : Comicana Books, 1986).
notes: Summary: Ditto practices golf with determination.

42.title: Hi & Lois
42.author: Dik Browne
42.series: Sept. 22, 1973) "Somehow He Manages to Hiccup in the Middle of Every Backswing"*
42.appears_in: reprinted on p. 153 of The Best of Hi and Lois (Bedford, N.Y. : Comicana Books, 1986).
notes: Summary: Thirsty's timing is off, but Ditto's isn't.

43.title: Hi and Lois
43.author: by Mort Walker and Dik Browne
43.series: Apr. 6, 1975) "Gee, Dad, I Always Wanted to be Just Like You"*
43.appears_in: p. 115 in Battered Husbands (Redondo Beach, CA : H. Gregory Associates, 1991).
notes: Summary: Hi and Chip are walking home from a movie, and Hi talks about the lack of worthwhile heroes in the contemporary world.

44.title: Hi and Lois
44.author: by Mort Walker and Dik Browne
44.series: Apr. 25, 1976) "Too Bad For You, Dad. When You Were A Kid You Missed All This!"*
44.appears_in: p. 116 in Battered Husbands (Redondo Beach, CA : H. Gregory Associates, 1991).
notes: Summary: The twins are enjoying an old movie on television and talking about their favorite actors and actresses: Charlie Chaplin, Buster Keaton, Fred Astaire, Cary Grant, John Wayne, Greer Garson and Katharine Hepburn.

45.title: Hi & Lois
45.author: Dik Browne
45.appears_in: reprinted on p. 153 of The Best of Hi and Lois (Bedford, N.Y. : Comicana Books, 1986).
notes: Summary: Hi tells Thirsty that one drink relaxes him before a game of golf. Thirsty falls asleep while lining up his putt.

46.title: Hi & Lois
46.author: Dik Browne.
notes: Summary: Hi says the hammer has to be back in two minutes or no pizza, and Dawg brings it back.

47.title: Hi and Lois
47.author: Dik Browne
47.series: 1978) "Golf Balls, Tees and a Six Pack"*
47.appears_in: reproduced on p. 154 of Golf in the Comic Strips, ed. by Howard Ziehm (General Publishing Group, 1997).
notes: Summary: Thirsty shows off his new golf bag, with an extra large pocket.

48.title: Hi and Lois
48.author: Dik Browne
48.series: July 13, 1979) "I Packed Up My Golf Clubs, My Bowling Shoes, the Booze in My Desk, and Quit!"*
48.appears_in: reprinted on p. 221 of The Best of Hi and Lois (Bedford, N.Y. : Comicana Books, 1986).
notes: Summary: At a bar with Hi, Thirsty talks about leaving his job.

49.title: Hi and Lois
49.author: by Mort Walker and Dik Browne
49.appears_in: p. 122 in Battered Husbands (Redondo Beach, CA : H. Gregory Associates, 1991).
notes: Summary: Thirsty made money in the stock market, but Hi can't afford to buy stock because he's buying diapers, toys, games, kids' clothes, radios, stereos, and saving for college.

50.title: Hi and Lois
50.author: by Mort Walker and Dik Browne
50.appears_in: p. 108 in Battered Husbands (Redondo Beach, CA : H. Gregory Associates, 1991).
notes: Summary: Hi has a talk with Chip about not using certain words, and developing a more refined vocabulary.

51.title: Hi and Lois
51.author: Dik Browne.
notes: Summary: Hi was on his way to play golf, but we see him digging a hole for Lois to plant a tree.

52.title: Hi and Lois
52.author: by Mort Walker & Dik Browne.
52.series: June 27, 1984) "Dad! Mom's Coming Out to Help You with the Grass"*
notes: Summary: Lois tells Chip she's not going to play monopoly because Hi needs help with the lawnmowing.

53.title: Hi and Lois
53.author: by Mort Walker and Dik Browne.
53.series: Apr. 28, 1985) "Babies Aren't Out to Impress Anybody"*
notes: Summary: Trixie looks the best in pictures.

54.title: Hi and Lois
54.author: by Mort Walker & Dik Browne.
54.series: Apr. 29, 1985) "People Who Lead Good Lives Sleep Good"*
notes: Summary: Trixie and Hi are asleep on the floor.

55.title: Hi and Lois
55.author: by Mort Walker and Dik Browne.
55.series: Apr. 30, 1985) "I'm Tired of Wasting My Time"*
notes: Summary: Lois complains about work like she used to complain about staying home.

56.title: Hi and Lois
56.author: by Mort Walker & Dik Browne.
56.series: May 1, 1985) "I Didn't Know You Could Be Put in Jail for Just Being in the Way"*
notes: Summary: Lois has to clean house, and Trixie is in the playpen.

57.title: Hi and Lois
57.author: by Mort Walker and Dik Browne.
57.series: May 2, 1985) "Last Weekend You Suddenly Went Camping and I Got Stuck Cutting Your Grass"*
notes: Summary: Chip complains that a paper route customer stuck him with the bill.

58.title: Hi and Lois
58.author: by Mort Walker & Dik Browne.
58.series: May 3, 1985) "A Baby is Nature's Way of Telling a Mommy the Wastebasket is Full"*
notes: Summary: Trixie explains one of her functions.

59.title: Hi and Lois
59.author: by Mort Walker & Dik Browne.
notes: Summary: Hi buys new golf clubs.

60.title: Hi & Lois
60.author: by Mort Walker & Dik Browne.
60.series: Sept. 5, 1985) "Hey, Monica! I Thought You Were Going to Walk With Me"*
notes: Summary: Monica said she'd like to take a walk, but didn't know it meant following Chip around as he mowed the lawn.

61.title: Hi and Lois
61.author: by Mort Walker and Dik Browne
61.series: Feb. 2, 1986) "Dad, Can I Change My Answer?"*
61.appears_in: p. 121 in Battered Husbands (Redondo Beach, CA : H. Gregory Associates, 1991).
notes: Summary: There's a power failure, and Hi and the kids talk by candlelight about what's most important to them, which ranges from peanut butter to family.

62.title: Hi and Lois
62.author: Dik Browne
62.series: May 23, 1986) "I Couldn't Stand To See Him So Happy"*
62.appears_in: reproduced (p. 221) in The Best of Hi and Lois, by Mort Walker and Dik Browne (Bedford, N.Y. : Comicana Books, 1986)
notes: Summary: Thirsty's wife thinks about divorce. We see him in his lawn chair in the tall grass of his lawn.

63.title: Hi and Lois
63.author: Dik Browne.
63.series: July 7, 1986) "Some of These Golf Outfits Would Look Great On Me!"*
notes: Summary: Lois shows an uncharacteristic interest in golf lessons.

64.title: Hi and Lois
64.author: Dik Browne.
64.series: Jan. 31, 1987) "My Ball Just Cracked in Half"*
notes: Summary: Maybe it's too cold for golf.

65.title: Hi and Lois
65.author: Dik Browne.
65.series: Feb. 21, 1987) "That's Ridiculous! How Can You Put a Curse on a Day?"*
notes: Summary: Irma is furious about Thirsty playing golf, and it starts to snow on the course.

66.title: Hi and Lois
66.author: Dik Browne.
66.series: Mar. 14, 1987) "They Say Your Weight Should Be Evenly Distributed"*
notes: Summary: Thirsty goes to the refrigerator to improve his golf swing.

67.title: Hi and Lois
67.author: Dik Browne.
67.series: July 2, 1987) "You Better Get Dawg Some Other Kind of Dog Food"*
notes: Summary: Dawg is dumping his dish into the kitchen garbage can.

68.title: Hi and Lois
68.author: by Mort Walker & Dik Browne.
68.series: July 16, 1987) "The Telephone Number of a Boy Who'll Cut Your Lawn for $4"*
notes: Summary: Lois is selling a house, and offers a bonus to the buyer.

69.title: Hi and Lois
69.author: Dik Browne.
69.series: July 27, 1987) "He Cut One Row and Gave Up"*
notes: Summary: Thirsty hired a boy to cut his grass, but it didn't work out.

70.title: Hi and Lois
70.author: Dik Browne.
70.series: Aug. 29, 1987) "I Just Lined Up a Golf Game"*
notes: Summary: Chip has fixed the lawnmower, but now Hi has other plans and Chip is stuck doing the yard.

71.title: Hi and Lois
71.author: [No author]
71.series: Sept. 5, 1987) "I Wanted Her To See What Our Lawn Could Look Like If She Really Worked At It!"*
notes: Summary: Irma Thurston is joining Hi and Thirsty on the golf course today.

72.title: Hi and Lois
72.author: Dik Browne.
72.series: Sept. 16, 1987) "Why Couldn't He Just Be A Fireman?"*
notes: Summary: Hi's job is described as "assistant vice-president for Southwest marketing in the fabricated metals division of Foofram Industries."

73.title: Hi and Lois
73.author: Dik Browne.
73.series: Oct. 7, 1987) "My Dog May Be a Mixed Breed, but He's Too Polite to Point!"*
notes: Summary: Ditto's friend brags that he has a thoroughbred pointer.

74.title: Hi and Lois
74.author: Dik Browne
74.appears_in: p. 27 in Battered Husbands (Redondo Beach, CA : H. Gregory Associates, 1991).
notes: Summary: Lois get's Hi's paycheck to put in the bank, and also keeps her own.

75.title: Hi and Lois
75.author: by Mort Walker & Dik Browne.
75.series: July 9, 1988) "You Might Like This Program That Analyzes Your Golf Scores"*
notes: Summary: Hi buys a computer because the salesman finds just the right pitch.

76.title: Hi and Lois
76.author: Dik Browne.
76.series: July 30, 1988) "The Grass was Tickling My Arms"*
notes: Summary: Thirsty has put his lawn recliner up on sawhorses.

77.title: Hi and Lois
77.author: Dik Browne
77.appears_in: p. 31 in Battered Husbands (Redondo Beach, CA : H. Gregory Associates, 1991).
notes: Summary: Do you think she actually likes having to yell and be bossy?

78.title: Hi and Lois
78.author: Dik Browne
78.series: Aug. 9, 1988) "The Curse of the Working Wife"*
78.appears_in: p. 37 in Battered Husbands (Redondo Beach, CA : H. Gregory Associates, 1991).
notes: Summary: Spending your own hard-earned money.

79.title: Hi and Lois
79.author: Dik Browne.
notes: Summary: Thirsty and Hi try to make a golf date.

80.title: Hi and Lois
80.author: Dik Browne.
notes: Summary: Mr. Thurston has fallen asleep on a park bench while jogging; Chip picks up his headphones to hear what Thirsty had been listening to.

81.title: Hi and Lois
81.author: Browne.
81.series: Nov. 7, 1988) "Ever Since His Friends Got New, Larger Bikes"*
notes: Summary: Ditto keeps leaving his bike in the driveway.

82.title: Hi and Lois
82.author: Dik Browne.
notes: Summary: The boss at Foofram Industries wants to know how many people called in sick.

83.title: Hi and Lois
83.author: Dik Browne.
notes: Summary: The song begins, We'll stick together, and Chip heard it in a TV commercial for denture adhesive. Call no.: PN6726f.B55 "Dentures"

84.title: Hi and Lois
84.author: Dik Browne.
notes: Summary: Thirsty's thinking about new clubs, and Hi recommends flexible shafts.

85.title: Hi and Lois
85.author: Dik Browne
85.series: Oct. 6, 1989) "Good Ol' Chip, He's a Born Husband"*
85.appears_in: p. 120 in Battered Husbands (Redondo Beach, CA : H. Gregory Associates, 1991).
notes: Summary: Chip asks Lois why Dad's money is both of theirs, but her money is hers alone; Hi overhears.

86.title: Hi and Lois
86.author: Dik Browne.
notes: Summary: Dad's cooking is improving.

87.title: Hi and Lois
87.author: Dik Browne.
87.series: Oct. 31, 1989) "That's Jerry the Golf Pro and his Son Tommy"*
notes: Summary: Hi knows who the trick-or-treaters in the golf cart were.

88.title: Hi and Lois
88.author: Dik Browne.
notes: Summary: Lois plans a beautiful garden, and Hi plans to shoot golf in the seventies.
Copyright 1989.

89.title: Hi and Lois
89.author: Dik Browne.
89.series: Apr. 17, 1990) "It's For Bachelors Trying to Impress a Girl on Their First Date"*
notes: Summary: Hi has cooked something from a book called Cooking For Men, and the kids like it.

90.title: Hi and Lois
90.author: Browne.
90.series: June 16, 1990) "I Got a Ten on the Next Hole"*
notes: Summary: Thirsty has saved the club that he got a hole in one with, in the case with his golf trophies. It's all bent up.

91.title: Hi and Lois
91.author: Browne.
91.series: June 28, 1990) "They're Great for Climbing Trees, Dad"*
notes: Summary: Hi can't find his golf shoes, and Ditto has them.

92.title: Hi and Lois
92.author: Browne.
92.series: July 6, 1990) "Chip Always Develops Engine Trouble When He Gets Close to Mary Leigh's Yard"*
notes: Summary: The sound of the lawnmower stops.

93.title: Hi and Lois
93.author: Browne.
93.series: July 21, 1990) "I Can't Use the Weather as an Excuse Not to Mow the Lawn This Morning"*
notes: Summary: Hi's mowing the lawn in the rain, so he can play golf later.

94.title: Hi and Lois
94.author: Chance Browne
94.series: Feb. 28, 1991) "I Always Thought That Was What Moms Did Best"*
94.appears_in: p. 123 in Battered Husbands (Redondo Beach, CA : H. Gregory Associates, 1991).
notes: Summary: Lois tells Ditto that she's not a mind reader.

95.title: Hi and Lois
95.author: Chance Browne.
95.series: Oct. 7, 1991) "It was a Par Five. I was On in Two, and I Four-Putted!"*
notes: Summary: Hi wakes up from a nightmare.

96.title: Hi and Lois
96.author: Chance Browne.
96.series: Oct. 9, 1991) "If They're No Good for Laughs, What Good Are They?"*
notes: Summary: Mom tells the twins not to laugh at Trixie's hiccups.

97.title: Hi and Lois
97.author: Chance Browne.
97.series: Jan. 23, 1992) "He Hurt His Back Playing Football, so I Gave Him a Whirlpool Bath"*
notes: Summary: Ditto has put Dot's Ken doll in the toilet.

98.title: Hi and Lois
98.author: Walker & Chance Browne.
98.series: May 2, 1992) "Is That the Grass I Hear Growing?"*
notes: Summary: Lois interrupts a peaceful Spring day with a hint about mowing the lawn.

99.title: Hi and Lois
99.author: by Mort Walker & Dik Browne.
99.series: June 27, 1992) "It's Usually Not Until Mid-July That I Lose Sight of Thirsty"*
notes: Summary: It's been a good year for growing grass; Thirsty is sleeping in his back yard.

100.title: Hi and Lois
100.author: Chance Browne
100.series: Aug. 1, 1992) "That's One # Less than Last Week"*
100.appears_in: reproduced on p. 154 of Golf in the Comic Strips, ed. by Howard Ziehm (General Publishing Group, 1997).
notes: Summary: Irma asks Thirsty how his golf game was, and he responds: *!!XX#@.

101.title: Hi and Lois
101.author: Chance Browne.
101.series: June 12, 1993) "The Spaces for Your Handicap are Way Down at the Far End"*
notes: Summary: Thurston has parked in handicapped parking, and is told to move.

102.title: Hi & Lois
102.author: Chance Browne.
notes: Summary: A bug in Thirsty's lawn feels secure in the tall grass.

103.title: Hi & Lois
103.author: Chance Browne.
103.series: July 10, 1993) "Ski Boots, a Spring Mattress, an Old TV Set, a Car Battery..."*
notes: Summary: Chip's excited about all the neat stuff he's seen while snorkeling.

104.title: Hi & Lois
104.author: Chance Browne.
104.series: Aug. 5, 1993) "A Safety Feature in Case the Car Flips Over"*
notes: Summary: Dot explains a bike rack that holds a bike upside down on top of a car.

105.title: Hi and Lois
105.author: Chance Browne.
105.series: Aug. 21, 1993) "Reverend MacDuff Invited Me to Play Golf With Him Right After the Service"*
notes: Summary: Hi explains taking his golf bag to church.

106.title: Hi & Lois
106.author: Chance Browne.
106.series: Aug. 24, 1993) "He Must Have Had Something Important to Do"*
notes: Summary: They're calling from work wondering where Hi is; we can see him snoozing on a lounge chair in the yard.

107.title: Hi & Lois
107.author: Chance Browne.
107.series: Apr. 23, 1994) "But I'll Hate It After I Cut the Lawn Another 20 Times"*
notes: Summary: It's Spring, and Hi agrees that the newly cut grass smells nice.

108.title: Hi & Lois
108.author: Chance Browne.
108.series: Aug. 3, 1994) "Or Else Mr. Thurston Next Door is Cooking Outside Again"*
notes: Summary: Trixie sees the sky darkening, and thinks it might rain.

109.title: Hi & Lois
109.author: Chance Browne.
notes: Summary: Thirsty ready to walk off the course, but he stops to give Hi advice on his swing.

110.title: Hi & Lois
110.author: Chance Browne.
notes: Summary: Hi and Thirsty see a snowflake on the golf course.

111.title: Hi & Lois
111.author: Chance Browne.
111.series: June 17, 1995) "Who Knew It Could Be So Much Fun?"*
notes: Summary: Thirsty whacks his ball three times in a sand trap while Hi hits his straight into the water hazard.

112.title: Hi and Lois
112.author: Chance Browne.
notes: Summary: Dawg can express his hunger even though he can't talk.

113.title: Hi & Lois
113.author: Chance Browne.
notes: Summary: He wants a match, she wants to volley, he wants competition, she wants to remain on speaking terms.
Key word: Tennis, tennis courts, he vs. she, she vs. he.

114.title: Hi & Lois
114.author: Chance Browne.
notes: Summary: Irma makes Thirsty's lunch every day to help him lose weight, but he stops by Greasy Joe's deli.

115.title: Hi & Lois
115.author: Chance Browne.
notes: Summary: Trixie wants to know how she's supposed to eat such big pieces.
Key word: Choking. Call no.: PN6726f.B55 "Safety"

116.title: Hi & Lois
116.author: Chance Browne.
116.series: July 31, 1997) "The Temperature is Always Milder on the Other Side of the Season"*
notes: Summary: The twins wish for snow in the summer, and summer in the winter.
Key words: heat, weather.

117.title: Hi & Lois
117.author: Chance Browne.
notes: Summary: Chip's not playing a song, he's playing a pentatonic scale.
Key words: Guitars, amplifiers, sunglasses, grandfathers.

118.title: Hi and Lois
118.author: Chance Browne.
118.series: Aug. 2, 1997) "Is It Okay If I Bring My Sand Wedge?"*
notes: Summary: Hi's all ready to play golf when Lois reminds him he promised to take everybody to the beach.

119.title: Hi and Lois
119.author: Chance Browne.
119.series: Aug. 22, 1997) "I Decided to Go Around and Around for a Change"*
notes: Summary: Chip is mowing the lawn in a circular pattern.

120.title: Hi and Lois
120.author: Chance Browne.
120.series: June 6, 1998) "Sorry, We Gotta Charge Extra to Move Your Husband"*
notes: Summary: Thirsty is sleeping in his chaise lounge, so the lawn service didn't mow that spot.

121.title: Hi and Lois
121.author: Chance Browne.
notes: Summary: Lois suspects that Hi skipped work to play golf.

122.title: Hi and Lois
122.author: Chance Browne.
122.series: Aug. 1, 1998) "I Just Wish He'd do Some Renovations on OUR House"*
notes: Summary: Hi's been doing carpentry, but it's been on Dawg's house.

123.title: Hi and Lois
123.author: Chance Browne.
123.series: Sept. 16, 1998) "Sorry, I Had a Slurp in My Ear"*
notes: Summary: Trixie didn't hear Lois call because Dawg was licking her.

124.title: Hi & Lois
124.author: Chance Browne.
124.series: May 1, 1999) "Back and Forth to the Cart about a Hundred Times"*
notes: Summary: Thirsty thinks he's getting enough exercise with his walking.

125.title: Hi & Lois
125.author: Chance Browne.
notes: Summary: Hi tells Thirsty he shouldn't make Irma mow the lawn. Thirsty agrees.

126.title: Hi & Lois
126.author: Chance Browne.
126.series: May 22, 1999) "That's the Putter I Threw In There Last Fall"*
notes: Summary: Hi thought Thirsty was fishing for balls in the water hazard.

127.title: Hi & Lois
127.author: Chance Browne.
127.series: June 5, 1999) "This Will Be Fun, I Promise!"*
notes: Summary: Hi has promised Lois he'll watch Trixie, and Thirsty he'll play golf.

128.title: Hi and Lois
128.author: Chance Browne.
128.series: June 19, 1999) "18 Holes for You, 18 Favors for Me!"*
notes: Summary: Lois makes demands.

129.title: Hi and Lois
129.author: Chance Browne.
notes: Summary: Lois asks Hi to take Trixie along for his errands; they end up on a driving range.

130.title: Hi and Lois
130.author: Chance Browne.
130.series: Aug. 4, 1999) "The Only Thing More Boring than Mowing is Watching Someone Mowing!"
notes: Summary: Trixie watches Hi push the lawnmower back and forth.

131.title: Hi & Lois
131.author: Chance Browne.
notes: Summary: Lois says Dawg is a super-mutt.

132.title: Hi and Lois
132.author: Chance Browne.
132.series: Oct. 16, 1999) "That Was Before Lawn Services Were Invented"*
notes: Summary: Hi tells Chip how his father used to make him rake leaves.

133.title: Hi and Lois
133.author: Chance Brown.
notes: Summary: Thirsty and Hi dream about playing at Pebble Beach, St. Andrews, Harbor Town or Augusta National.

134.title: Hi & Lois
134.author: Chance Browne.
134.series: July 8, 2000) "It Also Gets Mowed Once In A While!"*
notes: Summary: Thirsty refuses to help in the yard, saying the grass is always greener on the other side of the fence.

135.title: Hi and Lois
135.author: Chance Browne.
135.series: Aug. 26, 2000) "Divide the Greens Fee by your Total Strokes"*
notes: Summary: Thirsty has a way to make golf seem like a bargain.

136.title: Hi and Lois
136.author: Chance Browne.
136.series: Sept. 30, 2000) "A Little More Flip than Flop!"*
notes: Summary: Thirsty tries to hit a 'flop shot.'

137.title: Hi and Lois
137.author: Chance Browne.
137.series: Oct. 7, 2000) "No Animals Were Harmed in the Making of This Movie"*
notes: Summary: Chip and Ditto make a video of Dawg rolling over and playing dead.

138.title: Hi and Lois
138.author: Browne.
138.series: Oct. 21, 2000) "My Mental Game is Beating my Physical Game by Ten Strokes"*
notes: Summary: Thirsty plays each hole in his mind first.

139.title: Hi and Lois
139.author: Browne.
139.series: May 12, 2001) "Stop Talking to Squirrels and Start Mowing Our Habitat"*
notes: Summary: Thurston sympathizes with a squirrel who had to leave the Flagstons' yard because Hi is mowing the lawn.

140.title: Hi and Lois
140.author: Browne.
140.series: July 27, 2001) "Now He's Going to Wake Up the Whole Neighborhood"*
notes: Summary: Chip finally makes good on his promise to mow the lawn, but it's after dark and he's wearing a light on his forehead.

141.title: Hi & Lois
141.author: Browne.
notes: Summary: Chip mows the lawn but leaves a patch where Trixie left her ball. Hi wants to know why he doesn't just move the ball.

142.title: Hi and Lois
142.author: Browne.
142.series: June 15, 2002) "That's What I Call My 'Total Flop'"*
notes: Summary: Thirsty demonstrates a golf shot.

143.title: Hi & Lois
143.author: [No author]
notes: Summary: The kids want Mexican, Italian and Chinese food, and the restaurant they choose is called "The Great Melting Pot."

144.title: Hi and Lois
144.author: Browne.
144.series: July 17, 2002) "And Why is Ink Black and Mommy's Face Red?"*
notes: Summary: Trixie is drawing on the wall while wondering why skies are blue and grass is green.

145.title: Hi & Lois
145.author: Browne.
145.series: July 18, 2002) "He Spun the Globe and It Came Up Mexican"*
notes: Summary: Hi decides what kind of food to order.

146.title: Hi and Lois
146.author: Browne.
146.series: July 19, 2002) "Can We Camp Out In Your Yard, Mr. Thurston?"*
notes: Summary: Dot and Ditto want a wilderness experience, and the neighbor's lawn looks a little less suburban.

147.title: Hi and Lois
147.author: Browne.
147.series: Apr. 12, 2004) "I'm Glad to See You Learning How to Earn Money"*
notes: Summary: Ditto pulls the weeds, gets paid, and wants to buy a lottery ticket.

148.title: Hi and Lois
148.author: by Brian Walker, Greg Walker & Chance Browne.
148.series: Apr. 14, 2004) "Mommy's Going to Come In and Find I Knocked the Lamp Off the Cabinet"*
notes: Summary: Trixie is worried, and wants the twins to stop fighting.

149.title: Hi & Lois
149.author: Browne.
149.series: July 2, 2004) "What Are You, Some Kind of Martyr?"*
notes: Summary: Chip wonders why his dad always eats the heels of loaves of bread, crumbs of potato chips, "bruised apples, burned cookies, deformed pickles, cereal dust and leftovers."

150.title: Hi & Lois
150.author: Browne.
150.series: July 3, 2004) "Someday I Will Celebrate Your Financial Independence"*
notes: Summary: The family is watching Fourth of July fireworks, and Chip asks for money.

151.title: Hi & Lois
151.author: Browne.
151.series: July 5, 2004) "Our New Neighbor is a Celebrity!"*
notes: Summary: Chip Googled her, and found she was once in a soap opera.

152.title: Hi & Lois
152.author: Chance Brown.
152.series: July 7, 2004) "I Never Mind Being Bugged by a Butterfly"*
notes: Summary: Trixie makes distinctions among kinds of bugs.

153.title: Hi and Lois
153.author: Browne.
153.series: Dec. 20, 2004) "Can You Make It Kinda Sloppy so My Wife Will Think I Did It?"*
notes: Summary: Hi has a present wrapped in the ladies' department of a store.

154.title: Hi & Lois
154.author: by Brian Walker, Greg Walker & Chance Browne.
154.series: July 1, 2005) "I May Have to Get a Job Just to Get Out of Work"*
notes: Summary: Chip's mowing the lawn and thinking about getting a Summer job.

155.title: Hi and Lois
155.author: Browne.
155.series: July 30, 2005) "Chip, Would You Like a Job?"*
notes: Summary: Looking at Mr. Thurston's tall-grass lawn, Chip rejects the job.

156.title: Hi & Lois
156.author: by Brian Walker, Greg Walker & Chance Browne.
156.series: Sept. 3, 2005) "You're Right, Thirsty can Sleep Through Anything!"*
notes: Summary: Thirsty's sleeping in a square of tall grass while Irma mows the lawn.

157.title: Hi and Lois
157.author: by Brian & Greg Walker & Chris Browne.
157.series: Sept. 8, 2005) "Teachers Don't Want to Know What We Did!"*
notes: Summary: Chip's in high school and doesn't have to write an essay about summer vacation.

158.title: Hi and Lois
158.author: Chance Browne.
158.series: May 3, 2006) "What a Boring Life That Kid Has Staring at Me All Day"*
notes: Summary: Trixie wonders what the goldfish thinks.

159.title: Hi and Lois
159.author: Chance Brown.
159.series: May 4, 2006) "I Held Out 4 Minutes Longer That Time"*
notes: Summary: Ditto stares at the cookie jar for awhile first.

160.title: Hi and Lois
160.author: Chance Browne.
160.series: May 5, 2006) "I Can't Believe How Messy Chip Leaves His Bed"*

161.title: Hi and Lois
161.author: Chance Browne.
161.series: May 6, 2006) "A Head Over Heels in the Living Room"*
notes: Summary: Hi has had a skateboard accident.

162.title: Hi and Lois
162.author: Chance Browne.
notes: Summary: Trixie has "coughles" and "sneezles" too.

163.title: Hi & Lois
163.author: Chance Browne.
163.series: May 27, 2006) "Just Finish Mowing the Lawn, Chip"*
notes: Summary: Chip has mowed crop circles into the lawn.

164.title: Hi & Lois
164.author: Chance Browne.
164.series: June 2, 2006) "I've Figured Out How to Stay in Bed Until Absolutely the Last Minute"*
notes: Summary: Chip delays getting up for school.

165.title: Hi & Lois
165.author: Brian Walker, Greg Walker and Chance Browne.
165.series: Nov. 1, 2006) "I Love My Blankie All Warm from the Dryer"*
notes: Summary: Trixie like everything about it but the static electricity.

166.title: Hi & Lois
166.author: by Brian Walker, Greg Walker & Chance Browne.
166.series: Apr. 28, 2007) "I'm Picking Up Where I Left Off"*
notes: Summary: Summary: Thirsty's first drive of the season goes into the woods.

167.title: Hi & Lois
167.author: by Brian Walker, Greg Walker & Chance Browne.
notes: Summary: Hi wakes Chip so he can mow the lawn.

168.title: Hi & Lois
168.author: by Greg & Brian Walker.
168.series: July 21, 2007) "Dad Doesn't Understand the Fine Art of Negotiation"*
notes: Summary: Chip tries to get his dad to pay him what a lawn service would charge.
Art signed: Browne.

169.title: Hi & Lois
169.author: by Greg & Brian Walker.
notes: Summary: Thirsty demands beer, Lois reminds Irma that she's not his servant, and Irma brings him the beer.

170.title: Hi and Lois
170.author: Brian Walker, Greg Walker & Chance Browne.
170.series: Sept. 19, 2020) "I Like to Support Our Essential Services"*
notes: Summary: Thirsty orders pizza almost every night.

196.heading: Hi and Lois--Miscellanea.
196.title: "New Comic Strips Join the Lineup" section 5, p. 1 in The Chicago Tribune, Feb. 24, 2003.
196.author: [No author]
notes: Notes the arrival of "The Hots," by Stephen Hersh and Nina Paley; "Housebroken," by Steve Watkins; "Frazz," by Jef Mallet; and "Sherman's Lagoon" by Jim Toomey, and the departure of "Beetle Bailey," "The Buckets," "The Fusco Brothers," and "Hi and Lois." Panels "Natural Selection, Bizarro" and "Speed Bump" are replacing "The Dinette Set," "Drawing a Crowd," and "The Lockhorns."

207.title: "Hi! Are You the Dumb One?"
207.author: Schulz.
notes: Summary: Peppermint Patty meets her new tutor.

208.title: Hi and Lois
notes:
Newspaper comic strip originated by Dik Browne and Mort Walker, later signed by Chance Browne and Brian Walker and Greg Walker. Characters include
  • Hiram (the dad)
  • Lois (the mom)
  • Chip and Ditto and Dot and Trixie (the kids)
  • Mr. Thurston (a neighbor)
  • Dawg (a sheepdog)
